subject: AI & Agents
title: Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG)
description: A short lesson to help you apply Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG).

hook.text: The model's knowledge is frozen at training time. RAG gives it a live library card.

buildup.text: RAG retrieves relevant documents and injects them into the prompt before generation.

discovery.text: The model generates answers grounded in retrieved factsâ€”reducing hallucination dramatically.

twist.text: RAG quality depends on retrieval quality. Bad search means bad answers, regardless of the model.

climax.text: Combine vector search, keyword search, and re-ranking for robust retrieval pipelines.

punchline.text: Don't memorize everything. Look it up just in time.

quiz.question: What does RAG help reduce?
options: Hallucinations by grounding answers in retrieved documents
